intro: Cynoglossum laxum, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and small, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. It has a short flowering period in late summer and is often used in herbal medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties. Cynoglossum laxum is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
